intro: Atuna travancorica, commonly known as Travancore atuna, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces elliptical, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
